Who are you?

I’m a guide. They call me Leopard. As you can see, this place is surrounded by all sorts of danger, but we’ve got an underground sewer network that not many know of, with the fortunate exception of yours truly. We can get you out of the city to the waste processing station in Zaton. That’s our only destination.
Remind me, where do your routes lead?
Your only option is the waste processing plant in south-eastern Zaton. It’ll cost you eight thousand rubles.
Are you a guide?

Yep. Navigator’s the name. Can take you to a few places for a modest fee. Rookies are my customers most of the time, but I can lead any experienced stalker as well. No shame in that. I’ll break it down: you pay, I get you wherever you want to go, and I return here. I can take you to one of six locations: Yantar, the Great Swamps, the army warehouses, the Garbage, the Cordon, and Jupiter.
Sorry, where can you escort me?

To the the Garbage for seven hundred, the army warehouses for one thousand, the Rookie Village in the Cordon for three thousand, Yantar for thirty-five hundred, Yanov station in Jupiter for six thousand, and the Great Swamps, also for six thousand.
Who have we got here?

You blind or something? I’m the local guide here. If you need my help, I can drop you at quite a few places, such as our encampment in the truck cemetery or our warehouse in Jupiter. It’ll cost ya, though!
Who are you?
Nice to meet you, mate. Name’s Garry, and I’m a guide. Usually roam around the centre of the Zone. I can take you to the Bar, Pripyat, the Red Forest, Zaton, and the Jupiter Underground.
Forgot. Where can you lead me?

I can offer trips to the Bar for six thousand roubles, Pripyat for three thousand, the Red Forest for twenty-five hundred, the Skadovsk in Zaton for two thousand, and the Jupiter Underground for fifteen hundred.
To which places may I travel to, brother?

There are several. We have routes that lead to the Red Forest, the outskirts, and central Pripyat itself. I cannot take you to any of these locations myself, but you may go with your brothers. I don’t believe you’ll find that a problem.
Where can the guides take me?
To the Red Forest for six thousand roubles, the outskirts for two thousand, and Pripyat for one thousand.
Is there anywhere I may travel, brother?

Certainly. I may ask our brothers to lead you in exchange for a donation to the brotherhood. You may be taken to the outskirts of Pripyat east of here, to Jupiter to the west, and to the Red Forest located to the south-west.
To which places may I travel to, brother?
There are ways to the outskirts east of here and Jupiter to the west. Both will cost you one thousand roubles.
Hey, why are you standing there?

Well, there’s no time for me to sit around! Gotta be aware of the surrounding area, considering I’m the local guide. If you’ve got the money, there are a few places in the Swamps I can guide you to: the observation post, the water pump station, or the machine yard. I can also take you on a trip to the rookie village in the Cordon. If you’ve gone completely bonkers, Agroprom is another option, and if you’re in a good mood, there’s also the Bar!
Can you name your routes again?

These are the routes I take: the observation outpost for three hundred roubles, the pump station and the old church both for five hundred, the machine yard for eight hundred, the rookie village in the Cordon for fifteen hundred, Agroprom for two thousand, and the Bar for four thousand.
You’re a guide, right?

Yeah. They call me Tourist. I like to wander around in poorly-mapped areas to find secret paths that no other stalkers know about. Anyway, here’s where I can take you: to the Nuclear Power Plant for twelve thousand rubles, Pripyat for three thousand, Yanov station in Jupiter for four thousand, the Radar for eight thousand, the Jupiter Underground for just one thousand and Zaton, via Garry, for four thousand.
Where do you travel to again?

To the Nuclear Power Plant for twelve thousand rubles, Pripyat for three thousand, Yanov station in Jupiter for four thousand, the Radar for eight thousand, the Jupiter Underground for just one thousand and Zaton, via Garry, for four thousand.
To which places may I travel to, brother?
For your money, the brothers may be your guides. You may be escorted to the Red Forest, Jupiter, and central Pripyat. Come to us at any time for our services.
Where can the guides take me?
To the Red Forest for five thousand rubles, Jupiter for two thousand, and Pripyat for one thousand.
To which places may I travel to, brother?
I cannot escort you personally, but our brothers may show you where to go for a fee. We’ve got positions set up in the Red Forest, Jupiter, and Pripyat. We would be glad to assist you at any time.
Where can the guides take me?
To the outskirts of Pripyat for five thousand roubles, Jupiter for two thousand, and central Pripyat for one thousand.
You look like an interesting character.

Pathfinder Pilot at your service. There aren’t many places I can take you, but it’ll definitely be much faster and safer than travelling alone. I offer services to Pripyat and its outskirts via fellow guide Garry, though I can take you to Jupiter myself.
Give me your travel list again.
I can talk to Garry about getting you to Pripyat for four thousand, as well as the outskirts for five thousand. I can lead you to Yanov station in Jupiter by myself for two thousand.
Who are you?

The local cook, I guess. I can’t even make something simple like an omelette, but somehow, that’s the assigned role I received in the army. I’m not a real soldier, so they put me here in Yantar… Anyway, they call me Rookie; not far from the truth. Usually, I take to drinking because it’s so depressing around here. If that ain’t enough, this is the main base of the scientists, meaning my officers come here for inspections from time to time, and they don’t really fancy seeing alcohol… Last time they were here, they poured my vodka out right before my eyes. Bastards.
Go on.

Well, I know that getting ammo around here is rough, especially when Sakharov doesn’t even sell any. I can hook you up with some stuff, but only Soviet-era shite, unfortunately. I’ve also got a few outfits; everything I’ve managed to steal is mine. What do you say about trading with me for a few bottles of Cossacks? For five bottles, I can offer you four 9x18 mags or two mags of 5.45. For ten bottles, I can share four mags of 5.45 or one mag of 7.62mm 7N1, and for twenty bottles, I’ll fetch you an entire Berill suit from the bins… Don’t think I’m a scoundrel. It’s not that bad, and the lion’s share goes to the guys. They’ve left me their equipment in a stash. I’ll leave any goods between the hangars outside the bunker.
I’ll consider it. Thank you.
Find %s
A mercenary technician in the Outskirts has asked me to find %s.

We’ve been sitting on our asses here in Pripyat for such a long time… Surely, you’ve heard our story from Griffin. I’ve searched high and low for tools, but I’ve only managed to find low tier ones that aren’t suitable for extensive maintenance and customization. This is outrageous. I’m a technician, and I need proper tools to work optimally. Can you help me out?

We’ve been sitting on our asses here in Pripyat for such a long time… Surely, you’ve heard our story from Griffin. I’ve searched high and low for tools, but I’ve only managed to find low tier ones that aren’t suitable for extensive maintenance and customization. This is outrageous. I’m a technician, and I need proper tools to work optimally. Can you help me out?
Thank you - won’t be as stressful for the guys here anymore. I’ll give you a discount.
Find %s
A mercenary technician in the Outskirts has asked me to find %s.
Well, we’ve sorted out a few issues, but there’s still a lot left to do. Need better tools for even more upgrades. Mind helping out again?
Well, we’ve sorted out a few issues, but there’s still a lot left to do. Need better tools for even more upgrades. Mind helping out again?
Well done. Now I have a full set, and you can have all the discounts you’re entitled to.
Remind me, what do you have?

This is what I’ve got: for five bottles, I can get you four mags of 9x18 or two 5.45x39 mags. For ten bottles, you get four 5.45x39 mags, three packs of 12x70, or one mag of 7.62x54 7N1. For fifteen bottles and seven thousand roubles, I can share three box mags for the PKP… and for twenty bottles, I’ll get you an entire Berill.
I’ve brought some vodka.
Oh, finally… something to drink. Is there anything particular you want?
Six 9x18 mags.
Three 5.45 mags.
Six 5.45 mags.
Some buckshot ammo.
Two mags of 7.62 7N1.
Three boxes for the PKP.
The Berill.
I’ve given the signal to my comrades. You can go pick it up.
I’ve given the signal to my comrades. You can go pick it up.
I’ve given the signal to my comrades. You can go pick it up.
I’ve given the signal to my comrades. You can go pick it up.
I’ve given the signal to my comrades. You can go pick it up.
I’ve given the signal to my comrades. You can go pick it up.
I’ve given the signal to my comrades. You can go pick it up.
I’ve changed my mind.
Who are you?

I could ask you a reasonable question in return: ‘What’s your bloody business?’ But that’s not what you wanna hear, is it? I work as a trader and guide, and I know a route to our main outpost in the Dead City.
Could you remind me where your routes lead?
There’s only one route, remember? It goes to the Dead City.
Collect %s
Griffin has asked to collect %s.
There are just too many of those goddamn fanatics. Could you wipe them out? I’ve got a little something that could help you out in future hunts. It’s yours if you bring me twenty of their patches.
There are just too many of those goddamn fanatics. Could you wipe them out? I’ve got a little something that could help you out in future hunts. It’s yours if you bring me twenty of their patches.
Thanks, stalker. Here’s that little toy I promised you.
Find a Soul artefact
Griffin has asked me to locate and return a Soul artefact.

There’s no doctor here, and we’ve got to survive somehow. Ordinary medical equipment just isn’t enough for us, and not many of the men know how to use it properly. It’s hard enough taking care of everyone around here. So, I want to ask for your help. I’ve heard about an artefact called the Soul, said to have an ability to heal the wounds of people. Could you find one and bring it here for us?
You actually found one? I can’t believe it… Thank you, stalker! This will help the others. And don’t go without your reward.
Clean out the grocery store
The mercenaries want the dogs at the nearest grocery store taken care of.

Well, we’ve got another problem: there are dogs who have settled down at the grocery store, and that’s no good for us. They’ve been barking at us nonstop, and that draws unwanted attention. I’d appreciate it if you could clear them out from that place.
Thank you, great work. Here’s some money for your trouble.
Hey, what’s up?
Nothing much, just lazing around. I’m Leshiy, the local guide and scout.
And how’s the local intelligence? I presume you’ve visited many places?
Indeed. I’ve even been in an anomaly. Entered a spatial bubble with my squad back when I was a mercenary. It’s a long story. Anyway, if you need to travel somewhere, you can talk to me.
I’ll keep that in mind.
Lead me somewhere.
Sure, man. Where to?
Need the money first, pal.
Here, all yours.
Got the money?
Here, keep it.
Did you bring the money?
Of course. Here.
Forgot it.
I’ve changed my mind.
Miklukha
I need medical assistance.
Huh? Right, come on over.
You’re healthier than my buddy Vitka, boyo… and that rawny ponce is a drug addict!
Here.
This might sting a bit… Right, you take care now.
Locked stash
Worn notebook
A notebook, likely owned by Strelok himself. It describes in detail how to get into an underground complex called X18.
Greetings, brother. Do you have knowledge of any particular routes?
I know one. I can assist you in exchange for a Flash to the Monolith.
Here.
I lack that item.
I may give you what you seek in exchange for a gift to the Monolith: a Moonlight.
Here.
I lack that item.
I do know, brother. I will share it with you only in exchange for a Soul artefact.
Here.
I lack that item.
I may be able to assist you in exchange for a Wrenched.
Here.
I lack that item.
No, I do not know.
I don’t know, brother.
Man, what the hell were you shooting for? You almost killed me!
And what are you here for? No bullshitting. Don’t waste my time.
Okay, easy. Just passing by. Need any help? Can you answer a few questions?
I’ll answer, but don’t screw around.
I have a couple of questions.
Yeah? Spill it.
Where did you get this dog?

That’s Lassie. A sweet little bitch… If not for her, I’d have been devoured in my sleep long ago. Cursed mutants… I hate them! Soon as you close your eyes, they start reaching for you with their nasty claws, fangs and feelers…
I see.
Where do those puppies come from if your pooch is next to you all the time? Heh.
Why do you live in this rubbish bin?
It’s the Ark! Remember that… you will, if you want to live! When a Wave starts, stay close. Here you’ll have a chance to survive. No mutant will ever break in here.
What ‘Wave’? What are you talking about?

The creatures are watching me day and night. You do not understand… those snorks from the southern plateau have followed me right up to the Ark! I’m an experienced hunter and I know that they would not have chased the victim for so damn long. Something isn’t clear… they must have a collective mind of sorts. My thoughts have been confirmed by the recent attacks on the barge by those horrors.
I guess anything can happen in the Zone, but if your estimates are correct, we’re in some deep trouble.
Why do you not trust people?
Because I’ve been through too much.
I think I’ll go.
Tell me about this quiet harbor.

There was this strange stalker, turned out to be a major of the USS. He was a good help, and he also dealt with quite a few dangers. It’s only recently that everything went downhill… The Yantar psy-emitter and Brain Scorcher are both working again. There are clearly activities going on at the Chernobyl NPP, and it’s within reach. A squad of experienced stalkers went MIA, and after that another squad stumbled upon some Monolith near the sawmill, from what I heard. After that rumble with those fighters, people left, and the mutants have been using that to their advantage: they come up to this wreck almost all the time. Anyway… Generally, the northern part of Zaton is to be avoided.
Is there anything important to keep in mind?

Always - the local situation has given me a few more matters to deal with. People from the Great Land are losing their children, their husbands, their brothers… and of course, they themselves are no indifferent to their own fate. Lots of people have come to the Zone after hearing rumors about the money you can make here, and they also hide from problems of a different nature. I need their PDAs, and you’ll be rewarded for any you can bring here. Capisce?
So the North is afraid… Got it.
Who are you?

Ah, a new client… Understand that I’m not interested in who you are or where you come from. You choose what you need from the list and wait exactly one day until I get the goods. Moreover, I do not accept refusals; I don’t have time for games or bullshit, and I work without prepayments. Everything will be exactly on time, and you can order no more than one item.
I want to place an order.
Choose what interests you.
Pistols.
Remember, you may choose one and only one. Here.
The Steppe Eagle - a hand-made pistol based on the Desert Eagle design. Finely tuned to achieve incredible accuracy. It’ll cost you eight thousand.
You’ll receive a message on your PDA from me in exactly twenty-four hours.
Alpine - a modified SIG P220 with an extended magazine. It’ll cost you sixty-five thousand.
March - modified UDP Compact, high caliber and quick-firing. It’ll cost you seven thousand..
Shotguns and SMGs.
Right. Choose one of the following.
The Frasier - a handmade sub-machine gun based on the MP5. Increased caliber, improved characteristics over standard counterpart. It’ll cost you ninety-five hundred.
The Carabiner - an army-modified SPAS-12 with reduced recoil and automatic firing mode. It’ll cost you eleven thousand.
The Armsel Protecta - a shotgun based on the design of the Striker shotgun. It’ll cost you seventeen thousand.
I didn’t find what I was looking for.
Sniper and assault rifles.
Here’s what I’ve got - pick one.

Storm - a modified OTs-14 Groza manufactured for Spetsnaz special forces, secretly leaked to the masses. One of the advantages worth noting is the increased magazine capacity. It’ll cost you nineteen thousand.
The H&K G36 - a rare sight in the zone. It’ll cost you fourteen thousand.
The FN F2000. A Belgian rarity and a decent assault rifle. It’ll cost you seventeen thousand.
The Tide - an exclusive modification of the VSS Vintorez. Lower rate of fire, but increased stopping power. It’ll cost you twenty thousand.
The SVU2-A - an evolution of the SVUmk-2 sniper rifle. This weapon used to belong to Max, the legendary guardian of Freedom. It’ll cost you twenty-four thousand.
The SVD Lynx - an army modification that combines increased accuracy and stopping power. It’ll cost you eighteen thousand.
Gauss rifle. A trophy weapon - you can count the number of these in the Zone on your fingers. Absolute accuracy and damage with almost no recoil included. The price is one-hundred and fifty thousand.
Suits.
Alright, choose one.

A Monolith exoskeleton - the best combination of protective characteristics. In addition, you won’t get this anywhere else, unless you are a certain representative of the brotherhood. The price is at a hundred thousand.
A mercenary exoskeleton - perhaps one of the most reliable means of protection. It’ll cost you seventy-five thousand.
Bandit exoskeleton. Exclusivity in its purest form. It’ll cost you sixty-five thousand.
A Monolith suit featuring a closed-cycle breathing system; as with the exoskeleton, you are unlikely to see it anywhere else. It’ll cost you seventy thousand.
A Mercenary suit with a closed breathing system. Excellent protection from anomalies and a real rarity for the average stalker. It’ll cost you fifty thousand.
I’ve changed my mind.
I want to order.
Hope you have the funds to afford these.
Yeah, give me the Steppe Eagle.
Come again.
I’ll take the SIG 220 Alpine.
Give me the USP March.
I’d like the MP5 Frasier.
Gimme the Carabiner.
Let me get the Protecta.
I’ll place an order for the OT-14 Storm.
Wouldn’t mind the H&K G36.
The FN2000 sounds like a nice pick.
Definitely want the VSS Tide.
SVU2-A, eh? Sure.
I’ll grab that SVD Lynx.
I’ll order the Monolith exoskeleton.
Gimme the mercenary exoskeleton.
I’ll toss some cash at the bandit exoskeleton.
I’ll place an order for the Monolith SEVA suit.
Give me the mercenary SEVA suit.
Gauss rifle. Right now.
Forget it.
How do you cooperate with the Monolith, and how do you manage to get such unique armor and weapons?

If I’m not interested in who you are, then the feeling should be mutual, right? I’ll tell you this only your reassurance: I’m an intermediary. You’re lucky that I decided to cooperate with you, as I can be very selective with my clients. Believe me.
Is there something in that room?

Not something; someone. That guy in there is a veteran, and he can get anyone any kind of equipment. Even unique stuff. He isn’t accepting any visitors, though; gotta make sure you’re trusted for that. Gonna need a name around here.
So, can I meet this man now?
Hm… Alright. I’ll let Garik know. The name of the guy is Nimble. Head straight and then right along the corridor.
Is there something in that room?

Not something; someone. That guy in there is a veteran, and he can get anyone any kind of equipment. Even unique stuff. If you want to see him, go ahead. I trust you. You can tell Garik you need to pass. Just head straight and then right down the corridor. His name is Nimble.
Excuse me, Garik. I need to pass through.
Can I buy extra equipment?
That’s certainly possible, but nobody right now will want to sell you anything extra. You’ll have to gain some trust and experience, and after that you can buy equipment wholesale.
May I purchase more equipment from you, brother?

You may, although not at this point in time. First, I must see to it that you continue to carry the will of the Monolith towards the infidel masses. We may talk about this transaction when you gain more experience.
Huh? Oh, it’s you…
Tell me about yourself.

I serve as a medic. I went out on a contract here and was almost immediately assigned to the Fairway group after some preparation. We were somehow stuck in Pripyat after the collapse of the operation… Well, those of us who were still alive… Then a man from the USS helped us, and then they evacuated us. I still can’t get this one case out of my head: our commander sent me and a couple of guys to the kindergarten, in which—according to preliminary data—there was a device that interfered with radio communications. I don’t know what came over me, and I wasn’t feeling myself: I couldn’t see, I didn’t know where my comrades were, and something pulled a veil straight over my eyes. Right in that kindergarten, I found a damn refrigerator and hid in there. Then, I heard an explosion right above me, and I immediately felt better for whatever reason, but the refrigerator locked up and I couldn’t get out without outside help. I don’t recall if I locked myself in it or if it was a poltergeist that held the door closed…
And then what happened? Why didn’t you quit?

Well… I need the money. Why would I have come back here otherwise? And doctors are always useful… However, there aren’t a lot of them in the army at this point. Fortunately, though, I wasn’t demoted for the failure of the operation, but I wasn’t praised, either… unlike the major, who, by the way, is also around somewhere here in the Zone.
Understood. I wish you well on your travels.
I need medical assistance.
Alright, let me see…
Don’t be ridiculous. You’re okay.
How bad is it?
There we go. You’re all set.
Find %s
A member of Freedom has asked you to retrieve %s.
Man, can you gather some Duty scum patches for me? It’ll help me rest easier at night.
Man, can you gather some Duty scum patches for me? It’ll help me rest easier at night.
Maximum respect, bruv! Hold on to this artefact.
Find %s
A member of Duty has asked you to retrieve %s.
I’ve got some work, alright. Why don’t you go beat up a couple of anarchists? Those freaks are breathing a little too freely these days. And, as evidence, would you bring me their patches?
I’ve got some work, alright. Why don’t you go beat up a couple of anarchists? Those freaks are breathing a little too freely these days. And, as evidence, would you bring me their patches?
Thanks, pal. Here, take this artefact while no one’s looking.
Find %s
A stalker has asked you to retrieve %s.
Brother, could you fetch me some patches? I’ll give you this artefact.
Brother, could you fetch me %s? You’ll get an artefact as a trade.
A true brother, friend, and helper. Here’s your artefact.
Find %s
A bandit has asked you to retrieve %s.
I’ve got some dirty work. There are too many buggers out there interfering with our business… Whack some of them moles and return their patches to me, will you?
I’ve got some dirty work. There are too many buggers out there interfering with our business… Whack some of them moles and return their patches to me, will you? I need %s.
Proper good job, mate. Have my respect and an artefact.
Anomalous bread

A piece of bread as dark as the soul of the person that left it.

Gatekeeper:\nI see someone. Hey, stalker! Come over here, got a few words for you.
Knife required

Often used by stalkers as a fallback in case of unforeseen circumstances. Its features are simple, consisting of a strap which can be dropped along with the backpack at any moment, in order to run away quickly. Quite compact and capacious. Practically, it allows you to reset your backpack along with some content.\n%c[255,238,153,26]When used, it allows you to drop your backpack along with some of its contents.
A route between two areas has become accessible.
Griffin:\nStalker, you are in the territory of the Syndicate. You won’t be attacked, but we expect proper behavior of you. If you’re looking for work, I may have a few things for you.
Meeker:\nYour order has arrived, stalker. Come and pick it up.
What can you tell me about Cold?
What can I say? He’s earned quite a bit of respect as the current leader of our organisation.
How did he earn that respect?

You see, there was some controversy regarding Lebedev, our former leader—who, by the way, I personally never met—and he didn’t seem to take the opinions of the faction members into account during their reckless crusade towards the CNPP. That mercenary certainly helped us out, but in the end, it just wasn’t worth it. Those who remained at the base were unable to fight back against a resurgence made by the renegades. The significance of our struggle in the swamps was reduced to zero… and the sacrifices here and on the way to the Chernobyl NPP turned out to be in vain.
It seems like the faction’s resentment towards their leader at that time was justified.

There’s more to it. After our troops managed to return, we had to start a long conflict to take everything back. We wouldn’t be able to manage in day-to-day life without Cold. He rallied up a number of unaffiliated stalkers and got in touch with folks throughout the Garbage and the Cordon. Free stalkers helped us out, and having a charismatic leader certainly didn’t hurt. Moreover, he’s given an order to all fighters, without exceptions, not to leave this place. We’ll take any help, but we won’t continue risking the lives of our guys.
Whoever Lebedev was and what he did, you don’t seem to be the same faction as you used to be.
That’s your opinion; certainly has some value to it. Right now, we have no large-scale goals, nor any common ideology… Anyway, it’s probably time we cut the storytelling and start the trading.
Deal.
Whose pseudodog is that?
That’s Buddy, the Doctor’s dog. Doctor asked Cold to keep him safe, as he’s started getting a little old.
Well, by the looks of it, you wouldn’t say that he needs protection.
Looks can be deceiving sometimes. Buddy is a kind-hearted creature. Now, can I tell you about these dogs and answer your questions?
Go ahead.
Pseudodogs aren’t really dogs at all, they actually originate from wolves. Duty found that out while researching them.
That’s… I need to write that down. What’s the request, anyway?

By virtue of my profession, I collect all sorts of stories. To the north, there’s a place similar to our swamps, called Zaton. I hear there’s an old crank living in the old barge, and if the rumours hold true, he also has a pseudodog. Perhaps you can find out if it’s true, if travelling that far won’t be a problem for you.
Ok, I will check it out.
What’s the current situation?

Things are quiet with Freedom. Of course, there’s no chance in hell we’re leaving them alone; gotta keep our guard up. Other than that, the bandits aren’t particularly dangerous. The Blues Brothers to the west and northwest aren’t as interested in us as much as we are in them, but there’s no way to be sure. Again, gotta keep your eyes peeled, especially when they’re carrying out any operations. Other groups and clans don’t pose any threat, with the exception of the Monolith. It seems to me that something’s out there, and it can’t be any good. Fortunately, Freedom’s the one who has to worry about any border attacks by those fanatics.
How’s Duty doing?

Solid three out of five; decent. What’s good is the shaky stability in terms of fighters and their influx, people are going, so not everything is lost. What’s bad is that the control of the territories at the southern approaches to the eastern part of Pripyat; we couldn’t hold on to the Yanov station. The southern approaches to the Bar are constantly under attack by bandits and mutants, and they are sometimes pushed by the mercs from the east.
How did you lose your position in Yanov?

We had a weak link. Our idiot supplier was caught doing things he shouldn’t have done… The bastard started handing out weapons to the average Joe, mostly bandits and mercenaries. He got caught by local stalkers and was killed while making a deal with a few bandits. I was presented with claims as a leader. Then an unknown stalker appeared and got rid of us… And that’s how we’re here.
Understood.
Tell me about yourself.

I used to be stationed at the Agroprom Research Institute before I got a promotion. Before the Zone came into existence, I was a car mechanic. Duty noticed my skills as a handyman after I had been around for a while, so they decided to assign me as technician here. I prefer tinkering with heavy firearms and assault weapons… Hate working on marksman rifles.
What’s with the bottles? Didn’t think Duty allowed for drinking.

Duty lets me drink on duty… he-he. Bloody hell, it’s hard getting by without a few bottles… The work is pretty damn tedious, and boring. I wish I could go back to the Agroprom, but our base there is gone now. I don’t even know if I’d be alive if they had never relocated me. They say the base was lost during an emission in 2011… Huh, looks like we’ve gone way off topic. Anyway, don’t be shy now. Show me your toys if you need ’em fixed.
I’ll see if I have anything.
Who are you?

Congratulations! With a memory like that, you’ll be the next Strelok. Now listen carefully. I’m the big dog here, and you will know my name. I got here from Zaton some time ago along with my guys. We fucked the mutants out of the base and got it back up and running. Some sod set us up, pretended to be one of us and ratted me out. Had to get the hell out.
These rooks don’t even know the rules, copping the made guys like that. Whatever that twat’s name was, I’m gonna rip him a new one.
His name was Sashenka or something, and stay out of his ass. Your prick can’t be any larger than my pinky, and his asshole’s a metal maze.
Got it. Any tips on other groups in the Zone?

Simple. Don’t trust anybody but our guys with skulls on their sleeves. Pretty much everyone else is hostile; remember that. Just try to figure things out for yourself. If you feel something’s off, get your arse out of there.
Got it. Any safe places I can stay?

No such thing as a safe place in the Zone, boy, but don’t let this advice go to waste. North of us is the truck cemetery, and our boys there control the old checkpoint and the entrance to the army warehouses. Try not to hang around the cemetery at night, and stay away from all the old vehicles. Radiation levels there are high enough to make your counter ring down to your goolies, and that’s not even mentioning the creatures and anomalies. There’s the Garbage to the west; total chaos over there, and there’s a checkpoint to the north controlled by Duty. South of us is a forest called the Darkscape. Really wild place. You’ve got soldiers patrolling there from time to time and loners pissing about. Pretty big maze. Also, there are a few stalkers at the farm on the way to the Darkscape, so don’t fuck around. There’s a huge advantage in that forest: the road leads to the Cordon. You’ll easily find our guys at the vehicle station there.
Some scary information you’ve got.
And what did you expect, lad? No sunshine and rainbows. This is the real life.
Alright, whatever. Thanks for the help, boss.
Professor, do you have any new inventions that will help me survive in the Zone?

Yes, young man. My long stay in this bunker in the middle of this marsh is paying off. But all the devices and medicines I have developed are almost singular. Eh, if I had more resources… The previous group of stalkers, who went after the artefacts, disappeared. The second group is not very experienced, and so far there is not much help from them. I can not entrust a new detector to them…
A new detector?

Well, again let it out. Oh, my gray head. Yes, I received two Svarog detectors, which my colleagues invented from the vicinity of Jupiter. I gave one of them to my research group, in return they brought me artefacts with incredible properties.
Can I buy this detector?
Sorry, but it is the only one and therefore not for sale. And I do not have parts for self-manufacturing. Moreover, even though you are an experienced stalker, I do not know you at all. I’m sorry.
I can help get you new parts, for making a detector, if you agree to sell it to me later.

Well, in that case, I’ll need parts of the rare mutants. Let’s start with this one. Bring me 4 hands of a controller, 4 hands of a burer, 4 tentacles of a bloodsucker, 4 horns of a chimera and 4 feet of a snork. I will need them for experiments, since I have not tried to make Svarog on my own.
Well, I’ll get this, unless, of course, these cute little animals eat me.
What the fuck, grandpa? My skin is more expensive, go with such requests into a meat grinder.
Tell me about yourself.

What’s there to tell? I’m the local bartender - but who can tell amidst this crap, yeah? We’ve been stuck here for days, barely maintaining ourselves. I took part in the defense of the president’s palace back then, migrated to Switzerland. Then I came to the Zone. I enjoyed visiting the Bar with friends, drinking and reminiscing of older days… During one of such visits I was offered a place in the the Syndicate. It was barely upholding at the time, so Dushman and I are sort of pioneers in this. So what? The roundabouts are fitting, there are people who’ve been in Afghanistan and Georgia. But people from the Baltic aren’t too eager to come, never mind the first world countries.
Heard that you’re interested in faction patches.

How can I put this? Personally, no, I’m not ‘interested’ in them - however, with morale being rather low lately, it’s an optimal method for our guys to earn some spoils of war. Plus, the high-ups want them. Here’s how it works: you bring me patches from stalkers, you get some gear or nothing at all. All of it for ten patches of any faction, apart from those of Ecologists and the Monolith, you have a chance to get a subpar artefact, or not get jack shit. With fifty patches, you’ll have a chance to get a decent artefact and some rather solid gear, but there’s also a chance that you won’t get anything. And for ten Monolith or Ecologist patches, you will get a pretty good artefact with the same chance as for fifty patches of any other faction. Fifty Monolith or Ecologist patches will guarantee you an outstanding item and good equipment dedicated only to the most experienced of stalkers, no chance of losing. You might ask, ‘why so generous?’… Because many people prefer to keep the patches for themselves as combat trophies.
What about you? What are you doing with them all?
I collect them. Not your business, and since I organized this ‘lottery’, why should it be?
Who are you?

I’m a local informant, and I can offer you all kinds of services. At the moment, I’ve got different types of information, and maps with routes to various locations. Don’t ask me where I got this stuff.
Any free info can you share about the surrounding area?
Usually, info is how I make a living, but since everything’s quiet anyway, I can give you a bit of insight.
I’m all ears.

Well, you’re in Rostok. It’s completely safe for anyone on good terms with Duty. To the west lies the Wild Territory, the former western part of the Rostok factory. Rumours advise against going there at night. The best kill zones are held by the mercs, so you’ll likely be getting shot from two sides. There are mutants in the lower lands, and it’s better to find and stay on high ground, or stay by the warehouses… although, the mercs have those covered. That’s all about the Wild Territory. To the north lie the army warehouses, held by Duty’s ‘best friend’, Freedom. There’s nothing particularly interesting going on there, but it’s the last shelter around for sane people. To the east is the truck cemetery; stock up on anti-radiation supplies and ammo if you’re going there. There are a lot of mutants and sometimes the radiation is way past what even we consider to be normal. To the south is the Garbage… Complete anarchy going on over there. You’ve got mutants and thugs, but you’ve also got a neat marketplace, and plus, there’s some kind of hunter in the train hangar who might have some jobs to offer. That’s all for the roundabouts. Need anything else?
You mentioned something about a shelter for sane people?

Well, north of the warehouses is the Radar, an eerie place held by the Monolith. If you’re heading there, best stock up on ammunition and supplies. Let’s just say that it’s not the friendliest place you’ll come across.
Thanks for the info.
Got any special jobs?

We actually came here to retrieve info from lab X8, which is located near the Yubileiny service centre north of here; inside, there was an elevator that allowed us to go down to ‘minus first floor’, but we got interrupted by the fucking military. It’s because of them that we’ve ended up this deep in shit. Dushman’s going to kill us anyway, but maybe there are a few documents left… we’d have something useful to leave with, at least. I’d head over there again with the guys, but there aren’t many of us left and it’d be too much to handle, since we’d rather not spend any more manpower than we need to trying to somehow get away from the centre of the fucking Zone. Maybe you could head down to X8; there could be something left, and, well… you’ll earn some good money at the same time. You feel like going?
I’ll go.
No, thanks.
Here’s what I managed to find.
Stack of papers doesn’t seem very thick… Nevertheless, there are some interesting points here. It won’t be hard to find a buyer for such a find. Here’s your cut.
Find and kill the bloodsuckers
Return to Cold
So, he’s afraid to send me ‘this way’, but it’s okay if I’m going to fight against swamp bloodsuckers? Cheap salesmen even in Clear Sky, I see..
Following the tracks of Clear Sky: talk with Forester
Cold told me that the immediate participant of those events is Forester and gave me his coordinates. I have to talk to him and get to Limansk.
Following the tracks of Clear Sky: find Leshiy
Following the tracks of Clear Sky: talk to Leshiy
Well, back to the military. It turns out that the key figure of that battle for the bridge was under my nose all this time.
I only have to reach an agreement with Leshiy himself, I hope this will end my quest.
Following the tracks of Clear Sky: collect 150000 RU and bring it to Leshiy
Following the tracks of Clear Sky: go to a meeting with Gatekeeper
Following the tracks of Clear Sky: speak with Gatekeeper
Finally, soon I’ll be on the other side of the bridge and those running errands will end.
Need any help?
Well… I do have a couple favors you could do for me.
Find a new shotgun

My current shooter is crap. If you could bring me something better, like a Saiga… Well, I’m not sure getting a weapon like that in the Zone is possible. I have seen a few bandits with Armsel Protectas, though. You can bring me one of those.
Deal with the snorks at the southern plateau

It’s time to put an end to those horrid creatures. Every night, I hear them creeping around the barge, waiting, breathing and sniffing. To get to the southern plateau, you’ll have to use a nearby teleporter. I’ve marked it on your map; it’s not far from the burnt farmstead.
I’ve changed my mind.
Benefactor: help Noah get a new rifle
Benefactor: bring Noah an Armsel Protecta
Noah wants your help getting an Armsel Protecta so that he can rest easy at night.
Here’s an Armsel Protecta.
…Impressive. Thanks for the help. Now those beasts will think thrice before snooping around here.
Benefactor: dive into the teleporter
Benefactor: clear out the mutant lair
Benefactor: report to Noah
Snorks have been threatening Noah for a while. He wants you to clear out a lair at the southern plateau.
I got those snorks. There were quite a few of them. What were they hunting you for?
I’m not sure. I used to head over there once in a while to clean them up, but I don’t have any more time for that… Got to to keep an eye on the puppies. So, thank you for your help.
You’re the local supplier, right? What services do you offer?

That’s correct. I can provide ammunition our guys find in raids from time to time, in exchange for any foreign munitions you bring us. We also have some foreign ones, and the exchange ratio for everything expect RPG warheads is one to one. The weapons we have are all fine and dandy, but a few prefer using more domestic firearms, ammunition for which is more abundant… nonetheless, having anything to shoot with helps keep us alive and well. I can also give you RPG projectiles and M209 underbarrel grenades, which we’ve received in abundance for carrying out tasks, though, unfortunately, we don’t have any more grenade launchers to go with it. Medical assistance is also something I can provide.
What kinds of munitions do you exchange?

I have two hundred 9x19 rounds that I can exchange for an equal number of 9x18 armor piercing rounds, about three hundred 5.56x45 rounds in exchange for 5.45x39 rounds, twenty F1 grenades for the same amount of M209 grenades and ten RGD-5 grenades in exchange for three RPG warheads.
Think I’ll make an exchange.
Great. What do you have?
I’ll take two hundred 9x19 rounds in exchange for two hundred 9x18 armor piercing rounds.
I’ll take three hundred 5.56x45 rounds in exchange for three hundred 5.45x39 rounds.
I’ll take twenty F1 grenades in exchange for twenty M209 grenades.
I’ll take ten RGD-5 grenades in exchange for three RPG warheads.
I’ve changed my mind.

Then we’ve got a ways ahead of us. Get the cash out and let’s get going.

Bro, more than half of the stuff we got here is breaking apart, and I really need some tools to help out the guys. Wanna help?
Bro, more than half of the stuff we got here is breaking apart, and I really need some tools to help out the guys. Wanna help?
Oooh, yeah… That’s what I’m talkin’ about. Tell ya what: since you helped me out, Imma help you out with a discount.

The whole area is complete wilderness, but this place right here… It’s a bloody strategic point, mate! To get our comrades as much firepower as possible, we’re gonna need some better tools to work with. Help me out again, will ya?

The whole area is complete wilderness, but this place right here… It’s a bloody strategic point, mate! To get our comrades as much firepower as possible, we’re gonna need some better tools to work with. Help me out again, will ya?
Oh, man, you are simply the best. You’ll definitely be getting another discount for that!

Was just sittin’ around, chillin’ like villains, when I realised what we were missing. That’s right, even better tools! Anyways, ’sup with you? Wanna help find some?

Professor Sakharov has asked you to retrieve %s.
Would you like to assist me with some research? I will pay you for your efforts.
Would you like to assist me with some research? I offer a reward for %s.
On behalf of the scientific community, I thank you. Here is the reward, as promised.
Find two controller brain tissues
Professor Sakharov has asked for your help in finding two controller brain tissues for his research.

Hello again! For some time, I’ve been attempting to research psy-emissions, and I would like your assistance. No particular mental activity will be required from you, rather, the brain of a controller… or, two, if you will?
Excellent, please show them! Rather unpleasant, isn’t it? That’s just my job, however. Thank you for the help! Oh, and here’s your reward.
Clear the area
Scientists and military forces are in need of your help in protecting Yantar.

Could you help us with clearing out zombified stalkers? They’ve been an irritation for a long time. It was dreadful prior to the recruitment of additional security. Cries, moans, the sound of nails scratching metal… Bah, no matter. If you help us, I can share one of several artefacts that stalkers have brought here with you. Will you assist us?
Excellent. Now, all that remains for us is to conduct an educational programme for the idiotic masses moving into the Zone and any other psy-emissive areas.
Find the Compass artefact
Sakharov is in need of an artefact known as the Compass.

I, alongside the others working in this bunker, have all heard about a legendary type of artefact and its change of possession from one person to another. It’s called the Compass, and until now, it hasn’t occured to us to try to study it in person. Will you assist us in finding one?
Thank you for your assistance. You may have one of our best suits. I’m sure that it will save your life, likely more than once.
Hey, stalker. Need something?
Collect %s
Sultan asked me to collect %s
It’s time to remind those retards who the bandits really are. Tear off their patches and bring them to me, I’ll even pay you for it.
It’s time to remind those retards who the bandits really are. Tear off their patches and bring them to me, I’ll even pay you for it.
Got them? Here’s your payout.

Listen, what kind of mercenaries are we without well-maintained and custom equipment? You know, we used to have tools for anything, but some fuck stole them from the substation workshop. So, I need tools, and not shitty ones either. Can you find us some?

Listen, what kind of mercenaries are we without well-maintained and custom equipment? You know, we used to have tools for anything, but some fuck stole them from the substation workshop. So, I need tools, and not shitty ones either. Can you find us some?
Damn, you deserve a discount. Thanks.

Thank you. Let’s see how much I can help you and the others out with this!

Listen - let’s finish our job, shall we? I need calibration tools to make sure that no scumbag escapes us.
Oh, fuck… You are the hero of every technician! Well done indeed… I’ll be doubling your discount.
